definition: acrobatic display (esp. on horseback) (old)/variant of 懈[xie4] and 邂[xie4] (old)
to divide/to break up/to split/to separate/to dissolve/to solve/to melt/to remove/to untie/to loosen/to open/to emancipate/to explain/to understand/to know/a solution/a dissection
to put/to place/to release/to free/to let go/to let out/to set off (fireworks)

pinyin: Zhong1 guo2 Ren2 min2 Jie3 fang4 jun1
Zhong1 guo2 Ren2 min2 Jie3 fang4 jun1 Hai3 jun1
Zhong1 guo2 Ren2 min2 Jie3 fang4 jun1 Kong1 jun1

sentences.english: First came the PLA men, then the people's militia.
sentences.chinese: 人民解放軍走在前面，其次是民兵。

sentences.english: Violence troops of People Liberal Troops sending to SiChuan has reached more than 0.13million .
sentences.chinese: 派往四川的人民解放軍，武警部隊達到十三萬多。

sentences.english: Characterization of the North China People's support and the people's Liberation Army to fight a bloody battle scenes.
sentences.chinese: 刻畫了華北人民支前和人民解放軍浴血奮戰的場景。

sentences.english: The PLA men launched a converging attack on the enemy force in many column.
sentences.chinese: 人民解放軍對敵人的多個縱隊進行了集中兵力的進攻。

sentences.english: The heroic deeds of Lei Feng embodied the glorious tradition of the PLA.
sentences.chinese: 雷鋒的英雄事蹟體現了人民解放軍的光榮傳統。

sentences.english: They are making our thousands of warriors of the PLA go hungry in the cantonment .
sentences.chinese: 他們讓數萬人民解放軍的戰士們在營房裏捱餓。

sentences.english: He was taken captive by the P. L. A. men at the first engagement.
sentences.chinese: 他在第一次交鋒時被人民解放軍戰士俘虜。

sentences.english: Its founder served in the People's Liberation Army.
sentences.chinese: 華爲創始人曾在人民解放軍中服役。

sentences.english: Cadres of the PLA include officers and non- ranking cadres.
sentences.chinese: 人民解放軍的幹部包括軍官和文職幹部。

sentences.english: Well, in South Sudan we have an action plan with the SPLA.
sentences.chinese: 在南蘇丹，我們與蘇丹人民解放軍有個實施計劃。

sentences.english: When the People's Liberation Army crossed the Yangtse River, the U. S. colonial government at Nanking fled helter-skelter.
sentences.chinese: 人民解放軍橫渡長江，南京的美國殖民政府如鳥獸散。

pinyin: Zhong1 guo2 Ren2 min2 Jie3 fang4 jun1

definition: expeditionary force/army on a distant expedition
War of Liberation (1945-49), after which the Communists 共產黨武裝|共产党武装 under Mao Zedong 毛澤東|毛泽东 took over from the Nationalists 國民政府|国民政府 under Chiang Kai-shek 蔣介石|蒋介石
commander-in-chief/top military commander for a country or theater of operations
Chinese Nationalist Party 國民黨|国民党[Guo2 min2 dang3] and Chinese Communist Party 共產黨|共产党[Gong4 chan3 dang3]
Marco Polo Bridge Incident of 7th July 1937, regarded as the beginning of the Second Sino-Japanese War 抗日戰爭|抗日战争[Kang4 Ri4 Zhan4 zheng1]
Nanchang Uprising, 1st August 1927, the beginning of military revolt by the Communists in the Chinese Civil War
